result.execSummary:
The defendant Drevon A Grant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED. ------------------------------------------------------------------------
COURT FINDS DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR CIP AND SAP BUT ONLY AFTER HE HAS COMPLETED NINE (9) YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,888.04 and restitution surcharge Joint and Several with co-actors Jeremy L Thomas 2015CF46 and Jacob A. Curler 2015CF96 and Michael R. Kraft 2015CF62. Twenty-five 25% of all monies earned while incarcerated should be deducted and made payable to the victims for restitution.
-------------------------------

Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision fees.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
-------------------------------

No contact with victims A.F., A.L., M.F., or A.L. No contact with co-actors Jeremy L. Thomas, Jacob A. Curler and Michael R. Kraft.
No contact with C.I. 1118. No alcohol or illegal drugs. 
-------------------------------

Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge. Enter into and successfully complete treatment programming as deemed necessary by Agent.
-------------------------------

of Judgment of Conviction entered 12/28/15 AND Order entered 12/13/16
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal is extended to January 17, 2017.

Transcript of Post-Conviction Motion hearing before the Hon. Kristine E. Drettwan on December 1, 2016
Court Reporter:  Linda C. Matoska
Denying Motion for Resentencing

3:08 pm  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
DA Zeke S. Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Drevon A Grant in court, in custody with attorney Angela Dawn Henderson.  
Matter is before the Court on a Motion for Re-sentencing that has been filed by the defense.  
Court has reviewed the Motion and Memorandum filed by the defense as well as the Letter filed in response by the State.  
3:10 pm  Argument by Attorney Henderson with regard to the issue of Judicial estoppel.  
3:16 pm  Discussion between Court and Atty Henderson.  
3;20 pm  Argument by Atty Wiedenfeld.  He believes that Judicial Estoppel applies here.  Atty Wiedenfeld also believes the record is sufficient in that basically the court adopted the recommendation of the PSI.  
3:32 pm  Court makes record.  Court believes Judicial Estoppel applies here.  Court notes this was a joint recommendation that was made to the Court at the time of sentencing.  It was the defendant's counsel that put the joint recommendation on the record for the Court.  And the only issue was whether the defendant would be eligible for programming at some point during his sentence.  And that issue was decided by the Court in the defendant's favor.  Court cannot find that there is a legal issue here to vacate the sentence and re-sentence.  Court denies Motion for Re-sentence.  Attorney Henderson will submit an Order.  
3:31 pm  Court in recess.  

**12/15/2016 - Transcript FILED;  Court Reporter:  Linda C. Matoska  (df)
Notice of Self-Imposed Disqualification // DDA Haley Johnson
IT IS ORDERED that the time for filing a notice of appeal or postconviction motion is extended to January 12, 2017.

Order Granting Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
Atty Melissa Frost

9:03 a.m.  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  Defendant Drevon A Grant in court, in custody with attorney James B. Duquette.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Today was scheduled for sentencing.  The Court did receive Attorney Duquette's Notice of Motion and Motion to Withdraw as Counsel.  Court asks the reason for the withdrawal at this time.  Attorney Duquette makes a record.  Response by Attorney Powell.  Court grants Attorney Duquette's Motion to Withdrawn.  The SPD's office is aware of this Motion and will be appointing new counsel.  Court sets status conference.  Status conference scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 01:15 pm.

**AMENDMENT 04-01-2015 - TOTAL BOND COVERS 15CF41 AND 15GF266.  NO VIOLENT CONTACT WITH J.H..  "No violent contact" includes threats through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person or through a third party. 
Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH A.L., A.F., M.F., R.F (04-19-1999) OR A.L. OR THEIR RESIDENCE. NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTORS OR ANY INFORMANTS IF KNOWN TO THE DEFENDANT.   Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
